intro: Trachydium subnudum, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing, perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland desert environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with a creeping stem that produces numerous flowering shoots. Its ability to store water in its leaves makes it well adapted to drought conditions.
